title: AAQ: How do we not Overthink, Over Analyze | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Faith is common for any acquisition of knowledge, whether biology, botany, chemistry, physics, mathematics, any branch of knowledge if you want to acquire, faith is common.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of overthinking and argues that faith is essential for acquiring any knowledge, including scientific knowledge, drawing parallels between accepting scientific principles and accepting scriptural teachings.

segments.key_quote: So that faith in an authorized source of knowledge is essential for acquiring knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of having faith in an authorized source of knowledge, comparing the process of learning science from authorized textbooks and professors to acquiring spiritual knowledge from authorized scriptures.
segments.transcript: physics, mathematics, any branch of knowledge if you want to acquire, faith is common. But not blind faith. Faith in an authorized source of that knowledge.
